required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of the Just Right Challenge Food Club for Decreasing Food Selectivity and Increasing Mealtime Quality
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of the Just Right Challenge Food Club for Decreasing Food Selectivity and Increasing Mealtime Quality

collaborator.agency: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan Foundation

brief_summary.textblock: This single subject study tested the effectiveness of the Just Right Challenge Food Club for decreasing food selectivity and increasing mealtime qualify for children with developmental disabilities.

detailed_description.textblock: This study used a single subject design to test the effectiveness of the Just Right Challenge Food Club for decreasing food selectivity and increasing mealtime quality for children with developmental disabilities. Baseline data was collected during the time that participants spent on the wait list for treatment. Treatment data was collected each week during treatment session. This protocol produced a significant change in both the number of foods the children in the study ate as well as the parents perception of mealtime quality.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This was a single-subject (time series design).
study_design_info.masking_description: There was no masking. This was a single subject study. Participants allowed us to use their clinical data for research purposes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Every week for up to 45 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Parents marked the foods that their child ate over the past week every week for up to 45 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in About Your Child's Eating questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 45 weeks between pre and post test measures.
secondary_outcome.description: A measure of parent perception of mealtime qualify

arm_group.arm_group_label: Just Right Challenge Food Club Protocol
arm_group.description: There was only one arm in this study. All participants received the Just Right Challenge Food Club Protocol and single subject (time series) data was collected.

intervention.description: Systematic desensitization, positive reinforcement and escape extinction at a level of just right challenge.
intervention.arm_group_label: Just Right Challenge Food Club Protocol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children who accepted less than 15 foods as part of their regular diet
- Children who refused whole food groups
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children with life threatening food selectivity per parent report and physician referral information
